title: Grade 1
subject: Extended Content Standards For English Language Arts (2017-)

document.title: North Carolina EXTENDED CONTENT STANDARDS English Language Arts K-12

706EB194B7824B04B8490FBD962746A9.description: With guidance and support, use words acquired through conversations, being read to, and during shared reading activities.

23F7CCD232494909BE75F011652EC367.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.6 – Acquire and use accurately a range of general academic and domain-specific words and phrases sufficient for
reading, writing, speaking, and listening at the college and career readiness level; demonstrate independence in developing vocabulary
knowledge when encountering an unknown term important to comprehension or expression.

09EF8A17A1584F7B92C29E16817A098A.description: Demonstrate an understanding of present tense verbs.

10D13E6BF12C445FA193649EE877867A.description: Sort common objects into familiar categories.

693241C2E1904D31BAF4917AF998F16E.description: With guidance and support, demonstrate emerging understanding of word relationships.

4341644A2CA14DF29E2FA0F0AE62037E.description: CCR Anchor Standard L.5 – Demonstrate understanding of figurative language and nuances in word meanings.

A9F3E1320CEC4A02BEF2FA76259383C4.description: Demonstrate knowledge of word meanings used in every day routines.

2DDAB6982E0844238C3AC662B5D78360.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.4 – Determine and clarify the meaning of unknown and multiple-meaning words and phrases by using context
clues, analyzing meaningful word parts, and consulting general and specialized reference materials, as appropriate.

8A70B514692542A9A31CA7D4E20259C9.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.3 – Apply knowledge of language to understand how language functions in different contexts, to make effective
choices for meaning or style, and to comprehend more fully reading or listening.

2E0387C2EF2B4CA39284EEC71630166C.description: Demonstrate emerging understanding of conventions of standard English during shared writing within K-1 conventions continuum when writing.

EA42853CBF8C49ADBDD479E4B23AA7AC.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.2 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English capitalization, punctuation, and spelling when
writing; demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band conventions continuum.

4B792B7ED786452A98FB57200927AAE0.description: Demonstrate emerging understanding of letter and word use within the K-1 grammar continuum when writing or communicating.

4E0E840596F049358A9FFE085B0CCF6F.description:
CCR Anchor Standard L.1 – Demonstrate command of the conventions of standard English grammar and usage when writing or speaking;
demonstrate proficiency within the appropriate grade band grammar continuum.

1A7C893402204AEBBFFD6BBE1DD24D07.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.6 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

BE04D458E635441399945A638A6F593C.description: Add or select drawings or other visual or tactual displays to communicate about familiar people, places, things, and events.

AB339E5431F044A8990A9019AC56C066.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.5 – Make strategic use of digital media and visual displays of data to express information and enhance
understanding of presentations.

5470BC71ABD440B091FA791A0FBA7876.description: Combine two or more words when communicating.

F1826B0F3DED4C908A57818673CADD50.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.4 – Present information, findings, and supporting evidence such that listeners can follow the line of reasoning
and the organization, development, and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience.

95BF18341BC944459615E78040792EA1.description: With guidance and support communicate confusion, lack of understanding or a need for help.

7A9E40450F094786B6DFA6032A340FD9.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.3 – Determine whether information presented in diverse media (book, newspaper, video, television, internet) is
credible and identify discrepancies.

D5F7D064665B47C1BFC8AE89B0DD2049.description: During shared reading, identify key details in the text.

78838DC442394D25BD795CA6D76F133D.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.2 – Integrate and evaluate information presented in diverse media and formats, including visually, quantitatively,
and orally.

96572C2165D8462B88E9B3178F24C53B.description: Use one or two words to ask questions related to personally relevant topics.

91FA61AF730F44EBBC2D8C6BFF2A09DA.description: Build on comments or topics initiated by an adult.

834E4E10E7CD4F3FACC9AF5DC2BFC9B3.description: Engage in multiple-turn exchanges with supportive adults.

730A765DEE79415AA0DDA7FB7A844298.description:
CCR Anchor Standard SL.1 – Prepare for and participate effectively in a range of conversations and collaborations with diverse partners,
building on others’ ideas and expressing their own clearly and persuasively.

D8E21F920E95411AA9434005926D8509.description: Integrated into Standards W.1, W.2, and W.3

B3E05F641ED746C18884CF46137EA64F.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.10 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Write routinely over extended time frames (time for research, reflection, and
revision) and shorter time frames (a single sitting or a day or two) for a range of tasks, purposes, and audiences.

AE8FFFE5E9384DA1B9D7236743BC8455.description: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

5F54701F71CC46A3A0927EFD480AC79B.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.9 (in 2010 Standards) – 2010: Draw evidence from literary or informational texts to support analysis, reflection,
and research. Proposed: Omitted because it is an expectation of RL and RI Standards

0CEFCF13B10F49FEA2E87943B4575820.description:
With guidance and support from adults, identify information related to personal experiences and answer simple questions about those
experiences.

7377A6E496DB4392AA7BEF89A7FF200D.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.6 (from Proposed Standards – was W.8 in 2010 Standards) – Gather relevant information from multiple print and
digital sources, assess the credibility and accuracy of each source, and integrate the information while avoiding plagiarism.

3A12AB419DDA4B93A8650C52AC65FD8B.description: With guidance and support, participate in shared research and writing projects.

51A762E88B6A429BB606E500EFFBC503.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.5 (from Proposed Standards – was W.7 in 2010 Standards) – Conduct short as well as more sustained research
projects based on focused questions, demonstrating understanding of the subject under investigation.

FDE27564C3494DC8830F96C55D39D021.description: With guidance and support from adults, explore a variety of digital tools to produce individual or group writing.

936BFA5E18894DA3BDE59FBAED4E5218.description: CR Anchor Standard W.4: Use digital tools and resources to produce and publish writing and to interact and collaborate with others.

BD4DAEB48B274BA4ADCCC47FD137EAD2.description: Select a familiar event and use drawing, dictating, or writing to share information about it.

27697C8E7D0B4E5192D58FD37C7B6475.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.3 – Write narratives to develop real or imagined experiences or events using effective technique, well-chosen
details, and well-structured event sequences.

AA0FDFBE00A9404BAA50233B9903CC6B.description: Select a familiar topic and use drawing, dictating, or writing to share information about it.

2FD4B03495C94E8D900372CD10C94BCC.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.2 – Write informative/explanatory texts to examine and convey complex ideas and information clearly and
accurately through the effective selection, organization, and analysis of content.

2B84EDBA06D24C0582CD951959D02255.description: With guidance and support, select a topic and use drawing, dictation, or writing to state an option about it.

DFBC41E097EA4B35842BFEC2470796FC.description:
CCR Anchor Standard W.1 – Write arguments to support claims in an analysis of substantive topics or texts, using valid reasoning and
relevant and sufficient evidence.

ACC8FF6AA38B4ADE83884D7D3F470E29.description: With guidance and support, recognize familiar words that are used in every day routines.

6689C4D8D3964332879F7B632AD737DF.description: Identify upper case letters of the alphabet.

625DE2505D8B4979B0F57D2F5836EC6D.description: Demonstrate emerging letter and word identification skills.

221137AAEFB14592B51C820A042C0FF7.description: With guidance and support, substitute individual sounds (phonemes) in simple, one-syllable words to make new words.

FDB80B137C2C4CC5B8A8930C53452AEF.description: Identify a single syllable spoken word with the same onset (beginning sound) as a familiar word.

77842982D06B4E408DCF1AFB6FBA2F07.description: With guidance and support, identify the picture or word that corresponds to orally presented segmented phonemes (e.g., C-A-T).

410721FF3057456FBCF667DFB5132B11.description: Demonstrate understanding of spoken words, syllables, and sounds (phonemes).

A03548BF946548FAA37A441E0A55F99A.description: Selects or produces letters when asked to write."

94ED0A72A28E4DA6B62FC6629FA52A4F.description:
With guidance and support during shared reading, demonstrate understanding of the one-to-one correspondence between written and spoken
words.

64773BB765524B07BF02BD47CE1368A8.description: Demonstrate understanding of orientation of print.

B8015039A7D24A88A7521B72C8CEEEBC.description: Demonstrate understanding that print is read left-to-right and top-to-bottom.

292917F6A87D44649840E932F1414A41.description: Demonstrate emerging understanding of the organization of print.

5FAF9B3CDBDA4E4BBE3E3B4B6CCB6A7B.description: Actively engage in group reading of information text for a clearly stated purpose.

E4C3E1C78A6340E1B5C910373F95B543.description:
CR Anchor Standard RI.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting prior
knowledge and experiences to text.

5BBD751C9EDB482BBB8E2A9CBF2D7520.description: With guidance and support, compare two familiar texts on the same topic.

664635DC8921490B90684C0EB0622B87.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare
the approaches the authors take.

C886A9F7F0E449E8BB1CBD89DFEE3C09.description: With guidance and support, identify points the author makes in a familiar informational text.

EDA8D4230C32451A9DB0E0CCAF62A52F.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

78CAE713BB5640FEA1A65332B1C6D529.description: Identify illustrations or objects/tactual information that go with a familiar text.

5F369A119E524D07897DDCDBDD9FC2C4.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

4E5E9927F2394B39BDE9C352A0F358C2.description: Distinguish between words and illustrations in a familiar information text."

1A664005BB6344E8815D406F2382EE99.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.6: Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

F617714161784E299FD606F60DB118F9.description: With guidance and support, identify various text features such as print, pictures, and titles.

AAFE1E1A8CA24A4FB90885B7A9A2B809.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

C1633EBC4BC442A6ABA1C83CEBF7FF14.description: With guidance and support, ask a reader to clarify the meaning of words in a text.

BEE90BB11A784FA6941AED1B8DE86FF4.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning
or tone.

6FF912652A57461FB48E529F0A91F67E.description: Identify individuals, events, or details in a familiar informational text.

95F2DBA277B94F52B4C87D5CE10F2600.description: CCR Anchor Standard RI.3 – Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

5013ED18014A45FA862D22211C7FEC2A.description: Identify the main topic and retell key details of a text.

4B447D71F9354DA397994E711AE7CFC7.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.2 – Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

AAEED8BE37C244D4AF4E33706D614295.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RI.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.

42526A6ED58B43D581553E6EC6A318B3.description: Actively engage in group reading activities for a clearly stated purpose.

7ACD43A68CF6478F9F991EE0F75151BF.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.10: Read and comprehend complex literary and informational texts independently and proficiently, connecting
prior knowledge and experiences to text.

3A5B297393754A4EB2A0337BAA0AE18D.description: With guidance and support, identify experiences of characters in familiar stories as same or different.

697E7F52E5154C71ADE7691E1F868C47.description:
CCRAnchorStandardRL.9 – Analyze how two or more texts address similar themes or topics in order to build knowledge or to compare the
approaches the authors take.

FA4662E18576403692C099228256CF50.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.8 – Delineate and evaluate the argument and specific claims in a text, including the validity of the reasoning as
well as the relevance and sufficiency of the evidence.

D1D47134A60340EBB444F44664D3C55B.description: Identify illustrations or objects/tactual information that go with a familiar story.

3AD92E2EA87E40008E754C095003BF7D.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.7 – Integrate and evaluate content presented in diverse media and formats, including visually and quantitatively,
as well as in words.

BC980279119046B48A1C28A587A3F7D5.description: With guidance and support, identify the speaker in a familiar story.

A703A31C3FE14F039023BD152D0B519F.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.6 Assess how point of view, perspective, or purpose shapes the content and style of a text.

981634E082AA438F8BFBF5FAC5A38DA6.description: With guidance and support, identify a text as telling a story.

FDE781869E304CC38F61FC3807ED8241.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.5 – Analyze the structure of texts, including how specific sentences, paragraphs, and larger portions of the text
(e.g., a section, chapter, scene, or stanza) relate to each other and the whole.

F323433FBB1947FD801ED4A1D497A9EC.description: With guidance and support, identify sensory or feeling words in a familiar story.

B1359768A1E8469ABA505B5C6EBC3B70.description: RL.4: Interpret words and phrases as they are used in a text and analyze how specific word choices shape meaning or tone.

FA1AC08C8DCA46BA83C052460F34D1D1.description: Identify characters and settings in a familiar story.

E6F0BB7B12BE40828D03C43060C8EE4F.description: CCR Anchor Standard RL.3 –Analyze how and why individuals, events, and ideas develop and interact over the course of a text.

B1DF7194AA4044FBAED7D9B4803A84D7.description: With guidance and support, recount key details in familiar stories.

1889DC42CC37424C829192EE550D5532.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.2 –Determine central ideas or themes of a text and analyze their development; summarize the key supporting
details and ideas.

5A8E6A5E680A4AB7A125D056DD6F4C97.description:
CCR Anchor Standard RL.1 – Read closely to determine what the text says explicitly and to make logical inferences from it; cite specific
textual evidence when writing or speaking to support conclusions drawn from the text.
